description: Ukraine unconditionally supports the idea of a full ceasefire with Russia that goes beyond the one-month energy infrastructure truce currently under discussion, the nation’s envoy to the US said.
title: Ukraine Embraces Idea of Full Ceasefire, Envoy to US Says

description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation has formed a task force with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives to coordinate investigations into a growing number of vandalism and arson incidents at Tesla Inc.’s showrooms and charging stations.
title: FBI, ATF Form Task Force to Investigate Wave of Tesla Vandalism

description: Greenland’s hard-line independence party, which came second in this month’s elections, is set to stand outside a new government following disagreements over the territory’s path to break away from Denmark.
title: Greenland’s Hard-Line Independence Party Leaves Government Talks

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Tests Firing Power, SEC Nomination and the Outlook for SNAP

description: Risks to euro-zone economic forecasts are more to the downside than the upside, according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Jose Luis Escriva.
title: ECB’s Escriva Says Downside Risks Are Outweighing Upside Risks

description: A court in Ecuador narrowly confirmed the suspension of Vice President Veronica Abad beyond the end of her term, leaving President Daniel Noboa as the winner in their long-running dispute.
title: Ecuador Court Hands Daniel Noboa Final Win Over Vice President

description: US Postmaster General Louis DeJoy has resigned, hastening his previously announced departure as the nation’s postal agency looks to stem financial losses and overhaul its operations.
title: US Postmaster General DeJoy Steps Down as Deputy Takes Reins

description: Turkey’s Finance Minister Mehmet Simsek will hold a call with international investors on Tuesday, people familiar with the matter said, as authorities seek to calm markets following days of turbulence triggered by the arrest of a key opposition figure.
title: Turkey’s Finance Minister to Hold Investor Call After Days of Market Rout

description: President Donald Trump plans to nominate Susan Monarez to lead the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, according to a White House official.
title: White House Plans to Pick Acting CDC Head Monarez to Lead Agency

description: President Donald Trump said he will announce tariffs on automobile imports in the coming days — and indicated nations will receive breaks from next week’s “reciprocal” tariffs.
title: Trump Says Auto Tariff Coming, Teases Reciprocal Duty Breaks

description: Venezuela is cutting public office hours in half to ration electricity as high temperatures affect dams feeding hydropower plants, a move that threatens to further slow the nation’s economy amid threats of additional US sanctions.
title: Venezuela Cuts Government Work Week to Ration Power

description: The United Nations is reducing its footprint in Gaza after renewed Israeli strikes killed hundreds of civilians, including a UN worker.
title: UN to Pull Some Gaza Workers After Israeli Strike Kills Staff

description: The Atlantic’s top editor said he was added to a text group in which top US officials discussed plans to bomb the Houthi militia in Yemen, an extraordinary breach of security from an administration that has repeatedly vowed to clamp down on leaks.
title: Atlantic Editor Included in Trump Advisers’ War Plan Text Group

description: US Supreme Court conservatives questioned whether the Voting Rights Act can constitutionally be used to create majority-Black voting districts, even as a key justice signaled he wasn’t ready to address the issue in the Louisiana case before the court.
title: Supreme Court Conservatives Question Race-Based Voting Lines

description: This week is all about numbers, and how they are moving against Rachel Reeves.
title: Allegra Stratton: Can Starmer Say No to the Tech Bros?

description: President Donald Trump said he expected efforts to slash the size of the federal government’s workforce would bring it down to an appropriate level in the next two to three months as he met with billionaire adviser Elon Musk and Cabinet officials on Monday.
title: Trump Expects to Be ‘Satisfied’ With DOGE Cuts in Few Months

description: President Donald Trump reiterated his call for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates during a Cabinet meeting on Monday, as he continues to push the central bank on monetary policy.
title: Trump Tells Cabinet He Hopes Fed Will Lower Interest Rates

description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan pledged his commitment to the investor-friendly economy policies he embraced in 2023, blaming the opposition for market volatility spurred by the detention of his biggest rival.
title: Erdogan Vows Commitment to Economic Policy Amid Investor Unease

description: US President Donald Trump said in mid-March that the deal to grab a share of Ukraine’s natural resources would be signed “very shortly,” as he continues to push for an end to Russia’s three-year war in the country.
title: Why Trump Wants Ukraine’s Minerals and What’s on Offer

description: CBS News should be required to proactively release all transcripts from future political interviews on its broadcast program 60 Minutes, according to a media watchdog group.
title: CBS’s 60 Minutes Urged to Release Transcripts for Future Political Interviews

description: Crowds of students gathered in Serbia’s capital Monday to protest a government contract with US investors, led by President Donald Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner, to develop a hotel complex on the site of a former military headquarters.
title: Students Protest at Belgrade Site Earmarked for Trump Hotel

description: President Donald Trump said his former defense lawyer Alina Habba will become interim US Attorney for New Jersey, her home state.
title: Trump Picks Alina Habba as New Jersey Interim US Attorney

description: Senegal faces a potential delay in restoring support from the International Monetary Fund, which wants to understand how debt data was misstated for years before discussing a new funding facility for the West African nation.
title: IMF Wants Clarity on Distorted Senegal Data Before Program Talks

description: A federal judge blocked Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency from accessing personal information for millions of US union members at the Treasury and Education departments.
title: Judge Restricts DOGE Treasury Access as Likely Privacy Violation

description: President Donald Trump said he would seek a 25% tariff on any nation purchasing oil and gas from Venezuela, citing migration and criminal gang members in the US.
title: Trump Says Nations Buying Venezuela Oil, Gas Face 25% Charge

description: New York City’s congestion pricing raised about $52 million in toll revenue in February as President Donald Trump and Governor Kathy Hochul remain in a standoff over his bid to end the program.
title: NYC Congestion Pricing Raises $52 Million Amid Trump Backlash

description: A federal judge denied a Trump administration request to throw out a temporary order barring further deportations of accused Venezuelan gang members based solely on the Alien Enemies Act, further escalating a standoff between the courts and the White House.
title: Trump Loses Bid to Vacate Order Against Gang Deportations

description: The Trump administration has asked the US Supreme Court to allow the firing of thousands of workers at six federal agencies after a judge ordered that they be reinstated.
title: DOJ Asks US Supreme Court to Allow Federal Worker Firings

description: Countries in the crosshairs of US tariffs are rushing to offer concessions and other defensive responses to White House demands in the final full week before President Donald Trump stages trade “Liberation Day.”
title: Trade Talks Ramp Up in Race to Avoid Trump’s April 2 Tariffs

description: President Donald Trump will tout plans by Hyundai Motor Co. to invest $20 billion in the US, as the South Korean automaker moves to boost production on American soil and avoid his tariff threats, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Trump to Highlight Hyundai Plans For $20 Billion US Investment

description: Canadian Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre is promising a deeper income tax cut than Liberal Leader Mark Carney, as the two politicians battle to attract affordability-minded voters in a tight election race.
title: Canada’s Poilievre Promises Deeper Income Tax Cut Than Carney

description: The US Supreme Court refused to revive a defamation lawsuit filed by casino tycoon Steve Wynn, turning away a case that might have made it easier for public figures to sue news organizations.
title: Wynn Rejected by Supreme Court in Bid to Revive Defamation Suit

description: In corporate boardrooms across the country, immigration is dominating the conversation.
title: Corporate America Is Talking About Immigration More Than Ever

description: Greenland needs purchase commitments from either the US or the European Union to unlock investments into critical minerals, according to the head of the island’s largest bank.
title: Greenland Needs US, EU Commitment to Buying Critical Minerals, Top Banker Says

description: Angola raised diesel prices by 50%, the second increase in a year in a country where residents have long been grappling with increasing living costs.
title: Angola Hikes Diesel Prices 50% After IMF Call for Subsidy Cuts

description: Mexico’s inflation slowed more than expected in the first half of March, as the central bank is set to meet this week to consider a sixth straight rate cut and likely a second straight half-point reduction.
title: Mexico Inflation Slows More Than Forecast Before Banxico Vote

description: London homes are the most affordable they’ve been for a decade but remain out of reach for many people, highlighting the challenge facing the Labour government to fix Britain’s housing crisis.
title: London House Prices Become Cheaper But Are Still Unaffordable

description: Angola is terminating its mediation efforts for the conflict in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo to allow President Joao Lourenco to focus on his new role as chairman of the African Union.
title: Angola Abandons Mediator Role in Eastern Congo Peace Talks

description: The European Union’s trade chief, Maros Sefcovic, will meet US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick and US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer in the US Tuesday.
title: EU Trade Chief Sefcovic to Meet Greer, Lutnick in US Tuesday

description: At the bribery trial of former Senator Bob Menendez, jurors saw gold bars and cash he stashed at the house he shared with his wife, heard about the Mercedes Benz a corrupt businessman gave her, and watched video of the couple dining with an Egyptian intelligence agent.
title: Bob Menendez’s Wife on Trial Over Bribes That Ended His Career

description: Congressional Republicans returning to Washington on Monday will tackle their toughest test yet, negotiating a massive tax bill package to deliver President Donald Trump a signature legislative victory.
title: Trump’s Tax Bill Takes Center Stage as GOP Debates Scope of Cuts

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Xi Plays Hard to Get During Trump Ally’s China Trip

description: Two of the nation’s largest law firms are taking drastically different approaches to being targeted by President Donald Trump: acceptance and defiance.
title: A Tale of Two Law Firms: Perkins Fights Trump, Paul Weiss Bends

description: Germany’s Finance Agency confirmed it plans to sell €92.5 billion ($100 billion) in federal government debt in the second quarter, in line with an issuance plan published in December.
title: Germany Confirms Second-Quarter Debt Issuance of €92.5 Billion

description: The US could breach the debt ceiling sometime between mid-July and October if Congress does not act, according to the Bipartisan Policy Center.
title: US Debt Ceiling Breach Estimated to Hit as Early as Mid-July

description: A planned trip by US administration representatives to Greenland this week shows “a lack of respect for the Greenlandic people” given government negotiations are still ongoing, according to the territory’s election winner, Jens-Frederik Nielsen.
title: US Visit Shows Lack of Respect, Greenland Election Winner Says

description: Is there really a coherent strategy here?
title: Jim Millstein on the Massive Risks of Any 'Mar-a-Lago Accord'

description: Austrian intelligence officers investigating a Bulgarian for alleged espionage have uncovered a Russian disinformation campaign aimed at damaging Ukraine.
title: Austrian Spy Probe Uncovers Russian Disinformation Campaign

description: US and Russian officials were meeting in Saudi Arabia a day after American and Ukrainian teams held talks, as President Donald Trump pushes for progress in achieving a ceasefire in the war.
title: Russia and US Teams Meet After Ukraine Holds ‘Productive’ Talks

description: Hao Hong, a veteran strategist known for his outspoken views on China’s financial markets and the economy, said he will be joining the international unit of Huafu Securities Co. as its chief executive officer.
title: Outspoken China Analyst Hao Hong to Join Huafu Unit as CEO

description: Thailand’s main opposition party accused Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra of allowing her father Thaksin Shinawatra to unduly influence her administration’s policies and failing to resolve key economic issues.
title: Thai Opposition Assails PM for Economic Failures, Thaksin Clout

description: Japan has protested and sought the partial removal of a statement made by China describing a discussion held between Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba and China’s top diplomat Wang Yi, according to Japan’s government spokesperson.
title: Japan Protests China’s Description of Ishiba and Wang Meeting

description: After his biggest political rival was jailed, the president is banking on his NATO allies needing Turkey more than they need a fight over its democracy.
title: Erdogan Bets World Will Turn a Blind Eye to Turmoil in Turkey

description: Mozambican President Daniel Chapo met the nation’s most prominent opposition leader for the first time since a disputed October election that sparked unprecedented unrest in the southeast African nation.
title: Mozambique President Meets Opposition Leader Mondlane for First Time

description: Declaring a state of emergency in oil-rich Rivers State is misguided. The region’s problems are political, and an army crackdown won’t help.
title: Nigeria’s Pipeline Crisis Will Worsen Under the President’s Power Grab

description: Japan put the branches of its military under a single operational command, taking a step the US, China and other nations have followed to better prepare for conflict by ensuring coordination between their air, land, sea and other forces.
title: Japan Aims to Make Military More Potent With New Joint Command

description: An overwhelming majority of respondents in a public hearing has backed Thailand’s plan to legalize casinos, with the government signaling it’s open to incorporating suggestions to ease the high entry barrier for the locals.
title: Thai Casino Plan Wins Overwhelming Support in Public Hearing

description: SALT LAKE CITY (AP) — Former U.S. Rep. Mia Love of Utah, a daughter of Haitian immigrants who became the first Black Republican woman elected to Congress, died Sunday.
title: Former Utah Rep. Mia Love, First Black Republican Woman Elected to the US House, Has Died

description: Mark Carney began his bid for election with a stark warning that US President Donald Trump is serious about wanting to annex Canada, launching his effort to convince Canadians he can protect the country from US aggression.
title: Carney Warns Trump ‘Wants to Break Us’ as High-Stakes Canadian Election Begins

description: US Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem will visit El Salvador, Colombia, and Mexico for a trip to highlight the Trump administration’s border and migration crackdown, including a visit to the notorious facility in El Salvador housing migrants flown there by the US.
title: Noem to Tour El Salvador Prison Housing Migrants the US Deported

description: Rachel Reeves faces a battle this week to avoid dissent from within her own party as Britain’s Chancellor of the Exchequer prepares to announce billions of pounds in spending cuts.
title: Loyalty Test Awaits UK’s Labour in Crucial Week for Chancellor

description: The UK’s competitive grocery sector tends to ensure that food stays relatively cheap, yet shoppers are facing a curious situation as inflation rises despite talk of a supermarket price war.
title: British Appetite for Home Dining Poses Unlikely Inflation Threat
